owner.realname: Schlesinger Library on the History of Women in America

description._content: Description: Collection consists of eight small notebooks (May-Oct. 1893) detailing Viles-Wyman's travels to and sojourns in Lake Placid, N.Y., and New York City, including accounts of sightseeing, theater, dance lessons in New York, and discussions of dressmaking and fashion; programs, sketches, and swatches of fabric are included. Repository: Schlesinger Library on the History of Women in America. Collection: Lilla Bell Viles-Wyman Journals Call Number: A/V701 Catalog Record: INSERT PERMALINK HERE Questions? Ask a Schlesinger Librarian
